description: Standardized terminology for loan-related features with internationalization support

UK.rule: Top-up amount must be between the minimum and maximum pre-approved limits for the customer's segment and region
UK.rationale: Ensures the additional borrowing is within affordability parameters appropriate for customer segment and local market conditions

UK.rule: The remaining term does not change as a result of the top-up
UK.rationale: Maintains the original loan end date while adjusting the monthly payment

UK.rule: Pre-approval offers are valid for 14 days from initial presentation across all regions
UK.rationale: Ensures offers are based on current financial circumstances

UK.rule: Customers must explicitly confirm agreement to terms before disbursement, in compliance with local regulations
UK.rationale: Regulatory requirement for informed consent that varies by region

UK.rule: Top-up funds must be disbursed to the same account as the original loan or a verified account of the customer
All monetary values must be displayed in the local currency format for the customer's region
UK.rationale: Ensures clear understanding of financial information in familiar format

UK.rule: All content must be presented in the customer's preferred language when available in that region
UK.rationale: Ensures customers can fully understand all loan top-up details in their preferred language

UK.rule: Interest rates must be determined based on customer segment and region
UK.rationale: Different customer segments qualify for different rates in each region

UK.rule: Promotional offers must be displayed based on current date, time, and customer eligibility
UK.rationale: Ensures time-sensitive offers are only displayed when valid

implementation.validation: currentDate >= promotion.startDate && currentDate <= promotion.endDate && isEligibleForPromotion(customer, promotion)

UK.rule: Time-sensitive processing information must be displayed based on current time
UK.rationale: Sets appropriate expectations for processing times based on banking hours

UK.rule: Wealth segment customers must receive their segment-specific benefits on eligible loan top-ups
UK.rationale: Delivers premium customer experience to higher-value customers

UK.rule: All dates must be displayed in the region-specific format
UK.rationale: Ensures dates are understood correctly according to local conventions

internationalisation.translation_process: All key content elements must be translated into all supported languages for each region
internationalisation.testing_requirements: UI must be tested with all supported languages to ensure proper text display and layout

loan_topup.definition: Additional borrowing on an existing loan agreement

pre_approval.definition: A status indicating the customer has been assessed and preliminarily approved for additional borrowing

top_up_amount.definition: The additional amount a customer wishes to borrow on their existing loan

current_balance.definition: The existing outstanding balance on the loan before top-up

new_total_balance.definition: The combined total of the current outstanding balance plus the top-up amount

monthly_payment.definition: The regular monthly amount paid to service the loan

new_monthly_payment.definition: The revised monthly payment amount after the top-up is applied

remaining_term.definition: The number of months remaining on the loan agreement

apr.definition: Annual Percentage Rate - the standardised way of showing the cost of borrowing

confirmation.definition: The final step where the customer agrees to the top-up terms

disbursement.definition: The process of transferring the top-up funds to the customer's account

reference_number.definition: A unique identifier for the loan top-up transaction

relationships.description: New total balance = Current balance + Top-up amount
New monthly payment is based on the New total balance, remaining term, and interest rate
Offer presentation → Amount selection → Terms review → Confirmation → Disbursement
